data.text:
@RiverTamYDN @GralinBD @ChuckWendig The 0-4 age group has the highest death rate of all of the pediatric age groups excluding 17 and 17 year olds 

I’ll do a set of charts for that when I get home
@greg_travis @GralinBD @ChuckWendig It is still useful to see the younger breakdowns, especially 1 to 4 because they cannot be vaccinated.
@kknnaabb I went to CDC's WONDER database and it doesn't support your assertion

@greg_travis @DrCWerner Mord an & Selbstmord von Kindern führen die Liste der Todesursachen an.
Nach Krebs folgt Covid.
Die ersten beiden Ursachen lassen mich fragen, was grundsätzlich falsch läuft?
Vielleicht ist es auch ein spezifisches Problem in den USA, dass auch auf den Waffengesetzen dort beruht

@Nathonius1 @sarahbeth345 @greg_travis Check it out yourself. Let me know what you think.

https://t.co/NDqbwYetwW
@snorman1776 @sarahbeth345 @greg_travis I was answering you first question, to your second, you linked a screenshot of a table with no sourcing whatsoever. That’s not really evidence either

@greg_travis You don’t understand the data you’re looking at. 3-4 thousand minors die per year in vehicle crashes. Every year. Google it… there are tons of sources for this. Or alert the media of your shocking discovery.
@Nathonius1 @sarahbeth345 @greg_travis That’s quite the evidenced-based statement. Have a nice day.
@snorman1776 @sarahbeth345 @greg_travis We will probably always undercount as long as there’s collection bias and political bias around COVID.
